column2: NORTH CAROLINA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When you approach this sign, you must:
column6: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: go to work.

column2: 2. What does a flashing red light mean?
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 3. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column8: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column8: Side road

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column8: School zone ahead

column2: 6. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column8: reaction speed

column2: 7. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: low clearance.
column10: a low place in the road.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column8: Road curves ahead

column2: 9. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column6: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column8: stay in their lane.
column10: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Intersection ahead.
column10: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column8: Lane shifting

column2: 13. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.

column2: 14. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: require more space for turning movements.
column6: take longer than cars to stop.
column8: are easier for the driver to operate.
column10: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.

column2: 15. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.
column8: Replacing worn wiper blades.

column2: 16. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may stop to let out passengers.
column6: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column8: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column10: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.

column2: 17. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column6: turn left into the one-way road.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column10: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 18. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: anticipate errors by other drivers.
column10: use only one hand on the wheel.

column2: 19. To drive defensively, you must:
column8: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column10: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 20. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Return gestures and shouts.
column10: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 21. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Maintain the correct speed.

column2: 22. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

column2: 23. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column8: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column10: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.

column2: 24. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 25. Alcohol:
column4: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
column8: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.

column2: 26. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 27. Parking is not allowed:
column6: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column8: within 250 feet of a traffic light.
column10: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 28. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column6: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column8: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column10: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.

column2: 29. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column8: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 30. Parking is not allowed:
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column8: in a crosswalk.

column2: 31. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
column8: get an energy drink.

column2: 32. If your driver license is suspended by the point system, it may be taken for ______ for the first suspension.
column8: 60 days

column2: 33. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column6: before the traffic light turns red.
column8: before you enter the intersection.

column2: 34. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column6: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column8: Immediately come to a complete stop
column10: Slow down and be prepared to stop

column2: 35. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 36. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
column8: steady red

column2: 37. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column8: honk to let them know you’re there.
